oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Veterans; Recruiting & enlistment; Government officials
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Fentress County (Tenn.); World War, 1939-1945 -- Tennessee -- History; United States -- Selective Service System.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sergeant Alvin C. York, Chairman of the Fentress County Draft Board, is shown seated at his desk.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee. Dept. of Conservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin Cullum York, a Congressional Medal of Honor winner and hero of World War I, was born in Pall Mall, Tennessee. During World War II, York served as Chairman of the Fentress County Draft Board, signed up with the Signal Corps and the Tennessee State Guard, and took part in bond tours, recruitment drives, and camp inspections.
